alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:26PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Flagler, southwestern St. Johns and eastern Putnam Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Bostwick to East Palatka to Pomona Park. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palatka, Crescent City, Pomona Park, Hastings, East Palatka, Andalusia, Fruitland, Bostwick, Federal Point and Orange Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.
